alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Columbus; Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Brunswick, south central Columbus, northeastern Georgetown, southern Horry and south central Marion Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Longwood to near Rhems. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Myrtle Beach, Conway, North Myrtle Beach, DeBordieu Colony, Surfside Beach, Sunset Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Pawleys Island, Myrtle Beach Airport, Little River, Murrells Inlet, Socastee, Red Hill, Springmaid Pier, Garden City, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Cherry Grove Inlet, Iredell, and Carolina Shores. This includes the following highways... US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 12. SC Highway 31 between mile markers 5 and 24. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 9 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
